metadata.Title: CVE-2013-3221 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description: The Active Record component in Ruby on Rails 2.3.x, 3.0.x, 3.1.x, and 3.2.xdoes not ensure that the declared data type of a database column is usedduring comparisons of input values to stored values in that column, whichmakes it easier for remote attackers to conduct data-type injection attacksagainst Ruby on Rails applications via a crafted value, as demonstrated byunintended interaction between the "typed XML" feature and a MySQLdatabase.

criterions.comment: ruby-activerecord-3.2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
